metadata.synopsis: The players have agreed to help the Harpers ambush a caravan of Absolute cultists and prisoners. You've just arrived at the ambush site - the mood is tense, words are spoken in harsh whispers. When the Caravan arrives there's a monsterous drider at its head, muttering to itself, talking to an imaginary queen/majesty that represents the voice of his God, The Absolute. The player can try to trick the drider into handing over its magic lantern (the Moonlantern - a glowing lantern hanging from the end of a staff), although that could leave the drider exposed to the worst effects of the curse. Will likely end in combat, either because you signaled the Harpers to spring their ambush or because the drider got suspicious and attacked.

69.speaker: Kar'niss
69.text: Plan's simple: your brain-bug is the bait - they'll trust you. Lure them in, then we hit 'em hard and fast. Once they're down, you grab the lantern.
69.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Drider appears, leading a caravan of Absolute Cultists and prisoners, Moonlantern in his hand. The Caravan is silent, bar the drider muttering quietly to itself.NodeContext: Drider muttering to himself

197.speaker: Harper Branthos
197.text: Plan's simple: your brain-bug is the bait - they'll trust you. Lure them in, then we hit 'em hard and fast. Once they're down, you grab the lantern.

59.speaker: Harper Lassandra
59.text: If you can distract them with that tadpole of yours, we can attack from up here. It'll be over before they know it, and then you can collect the lantern.

152.text: The Absolute guided me here. She said a mere drider was not worthy - that I must take your lantern.

175.speaker: Player
175.text: Our wondrous Queen dropped me a message - she said you need to give me that lantern. It's very important.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: You're holding my lantern. The Absolute said you had to give it to me.

115.speaker: Player

92.speaker: Player

187.speaker: Kar'niss

96.text: Protects us from what? What are the shadows, exactly?

145.text: But do not worry, there is still power in the lantern. Our queen will protect you, as she protected me.

131.speaker: Kar'niss

34.speaker: Player

38.speaker: Player

36.speaker: Player

4.speaker: Player
4.text: (Wave hands.) There - you now carry the blessing of the Absolute. You'll be safe.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: The Absolute has blessed you. You will be safe.

120.speaker: Kar'niss
120.text: If - if it is her majesty's will...

221.speaker: Kar'niss
221.text: If - if it is her majesty's will...

162.speaker: Kansif
162.text: You can't be serious. You know what's out there-

208.speaker: Kar'niss
208.text: IF IT IS HER MAJESTY'S WILL, THEN WE SHALL WALK!

171.speaker: Kar'niss
171.text: She will protect us. She - she must.

205.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The HALF-ORC shoots you a dirty look, but follows the DRIDER into the darkness, along with the other cultists. There is silence for a beat before screams start to pierce the air. There is sound of a brief battle. 

To account for Vez being dead or alive we will rely on a Show Actor key in Node N858.

199.speaker: Kar'niss

13.text: I'd never believe it if I hadn't just seen it. Nicely done!

132.speaker: Narrator

104.text: They think us fools, Majesty. They think we cannot see through their lies.

203.text: They think us fools, Majesty. They think we cannot see through their lies.

100.speaker: Kar'niss
100.text: We will punish them for this blasphemy. We will make them scream!

51.speaker: Player

193.text: Our goddess protects us. We carry her sacred light to drive back the shadows.

63.text: To arms! Strike down the heretics!

158.speaker: Kar'niss
158.text: To arms! Strike down the heretics!

186.speaker: Harper Skywin
186.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers stand up, revealed in the darknessNodeContext: Player just betrayed you and ratted you out

214.speaker: Kar'niss
214.text: To have a rage so fierce the dark quivers - you must have blessed them, my Queen! But if so... where is their lantern?

25.speaker: Player
25.text: I am not one of hers - divine light guides my footfall.

116.speaker: Kar'niss
116.text: There is but one god - and she is Absolute.

215.speaker: Player
215.text: Takes more than shadows to put someone like me down.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: I have tested my mind and body beyond to its absolute limits - I do not fear the darkness.

15.speaker: Kar'niss
15.text: A mere mortal warrior could have never persevered alone... Ah! Of course!

99.speaker: Player
99.text: With the aid of my mind and my magic, for I am a master of both.

182.speaker: Kar'niss
182.text: Magic alone could never have persevered... Ah! Of course!

204.speaker: Player
204.text: I swore an oath - a powerful one. It will take more than darkness to end me.

129.speaker: Kar'niss
129.text: Ah, you swore an oath to my Queen! But if so... where is their lantern?

12.speaker: Player
12.text: No higher forces protect me - I survived by my own tenacity.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: I am a guardian of nature - and in return nature protects me.

64.speaker: Kar'niss
64.text: But the druids have no power here, not since... Ah, of course!

178.speaker: Player
178.text: You know what they say - a ballad a day, keeps the darkness away!

19.speaker: Kar'niss
19.text: To make the darkness quiver with mere song - you must have blessed them, my Queen. But if so... where is their lantern?

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Navigating dangerous terrain is second nature to me.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: I burn with pure arcana - how on earth do you survive?

112.text: *Your minds connect and before you can stop him, the drider is inside your head - scrabbling through your secrets.*

211.speaker: Narrator
211.text: *Your minds connect and before you can stop him, the drider is inside your head - scrabbling through your secrets.*
